contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | image = Heterodontus zebra csiro-nfc.jpg | status = LC | status_system = IUCN3.1 | regnum = [[Animalia]] | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Chondrichthyes]] | subclassis = [[Elasmobranchii]] | ordo = [[Heterodontiformes]] | familia = [[Heterodontidae]] | genus = ''[[Heterodontus]]'' | species = '''''H. zebra ''''' | range_map = Heterodontus zebra distmap.png | range_map_caption = Range of zebra bullhead shark (in blue) | binomial = ''Heterodontus zebra'' | binomial_authority = ([[John Edward Gray|J. E. Gray]], 1831) }} {{Portal|Sharks}} The '''Zebra bullhead shark''' (''Heterodontus zebra'') is a [[bullhead shark]] of the [[family (biology)|family]] [[Heterodontidae]], found in the [[subtropical]] western [[Pacific Ocean]] between latitudes [[40th parallel north|40° N]] to [[20th parallel south|20° S]], at depths of between 50 and 200 m. Its length is up to 1.25 m. Reproduction is [[oviparous]]. ==References== *{{FishBase_species| genus = Heterodontus | species = zebra | month = May | year = 2006}} {{Heterodontiformes}} [[Category:Heterodontidae]]
